page.title: 01May Beck Area
page.content: Dominated by open heather moorland in the east and forested in the west. Large conferous plantations and north of these along May Beck valley are quite octensive deciduous woodlands. some farming is mixed arable and grazing between the woods and also rough unenclosed sheep razing. New plantations are in some moorland. No villages and there are only 4 farms and a fild study centre so most resident are involved in farming and teaching. The close proximity of waterfalls, high moors, and forested land make this a popular area with tourists and walkers. A marked nature trail on forestry commission land is aso popular. The moorland is robably used for grouse shooting. The main A17 road passes through the area but there are no amenities in this scenic National Park block.
